Package model

this package contains all of the data structures used to model the state of the five-in-a-row game, and for processing the rules of the game.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    GameListener
    A GameListener is any object that wants to respond whenever a Game object changes.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Board
    A Board object represents the state of a board at a given point in time.
    Game
    A Game object maintains the state of the game: whose turn it is, and what the board looks like.
    Line
    A line represents SIZE contiguous locations along a given row, column, or diagonal.
    Location
    A Location is a (row, column) pair, where the row and column are in the ranges 0..NUM_ROWS-1 and 0..NUM_COLS-1 respectively.
    Victory
    A Victory object contains information about a game that has been won: who won, and which positions form their "five in a row".
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Board.State
    The possible states of the game.
    Player
    There are two players; X and O
  • Error Summary 
    Error Description
    NotImplementedException
    A NotImplementedException indicates that the software is incomplete.

Package model Description

this package contains all of the data structures used to model the state of the five-in-a-row game, and for processing the rules of the game.

The Game class is the primary interface with the rest of the system. The other classes (Board, Player, Location, Victory, etc) are simple data structures.
